body: Yes, I think `x/sys` is the correct place for this. I'm not terribly keen on `fsn`, though. The `fs` part is obvious. The `n` is not. If there are no plans to put a common API in place, why do we even need a new paclage? It can just be added to `x/sys/unix` or `x/sys/windows`? Or: we can add `x/sys/linux`, `x/sys/freebsd`, etc.
